page.title: 05Jobs in Burford
page.content: Nearly two thirds of Burford people who have jobs work in the town. Those who have no regular paid jobs are mainly older folk above the age of sixty. Men and women hold full time jobs in shops and trade, in hotels and pubs, in building and service industries and the professions. Quite a lot of women also work part-time but only a few men. Most people who are employed outside the Burford area work in Witney, Carterton or Oxford, or within a fifteen miles radius of the town. A few people work further afield including one person who commutes by air. Local job vacancies are advertised at the Post Office. A number of individuals work seasonally, particularly in jobs connected with the tourist industry and farming. Unemployment is not considered to be an overwhelming problem locally.
